name: Novotel Ottawa

reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is in an absolutely perfect location. It is two blocks away from the Byward Market, directly across the street from the Rideau Centre and about a 10 minute walk from Parliament. My boyfriend and I were traveling on a budget and we were both amazed at the service of this hotel for the price. It was one of the most economical and the amenities in the room were great. This hotel is extremely modern, offers internet access, has a pool and work out room. We especially enjoyed the huge flat screen televisions on the wall. Fabulous time and the hotel staff were very knowledgeable.

reviews.title: Modern and convenient
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a night. The thing that I liked the most was the modern design of the hotel room. It is very conveniently located. Only five-ten minutes walking distance away from Parliament Hill. Less than five minutes to Byward Market. Right across the street from Rideau Shopping Centre. I would stay there again if I visited Ottowa again.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with good facilities and central location
reviews.text: Arrived on 31st January for a 4 night break visiting friends. I wanted something close to shops and restaurants and I don't think I could have picked anything closer.

reviews.title: Loved the Novotel
reviews.text: Check in was very quick and efficient. I had a one-bedroom Junior Suite on the 6th floor which had very recently been refurbished and everything was clean and practically new. It was very nice. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable.

reviews.title: reliable and decent stay
reviews.text: I can't comment on the breakfast buffet as I didn't use it, but the restaurant service and food was very good on the one evening we ate there.

reviews.title: A very quiet hotel
reviews.text: One point that others have not sufficiently stressed about this hotel....It is quiet. I have stayed there numerous times over the last few years for business trips of one to four nights and I have never heard a pin drop in the adjacent rooms or been bothered by noise from the hallway. I always ask for a quiet room and that is what I have received.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Other things I like: I find the beds are super comfortable, the big flat screen is a plus, wired internet is included and there is wireless throughout the lobby and restaurant area. The rooms are stylish and impeccable. Bathrooms are better than other hotels in this price range. Room service arrives on time and the breakfast is quite passable if you want some eggs for a big day ahead. Breakfast in the resto is OK; the best thing is the bread, croissants, etc. The staff in the Novotel are very pleasant; I have never had a bad experience with them. The location is excellent and there is easy access to 417.

reviews.title: So, so
reviews.text: Downsides: Parking is expensive and service less than stellar in the garage. They are quite surly if you lose your ticket! As noted by other reviewers, you do not go to the Novotel to use the pool and you can expect to wait for the elevator. It would be nice if they had wireless throughout the hotel.

reviews.title: Comfy, clean and convenient
reviews.text: Overall, this hotel is great and I always stay there when I'm in Ottawa.

reviews.title: Nice clean hotel
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel for downtown Ottawa at a very reasonible price compares nicely with some of the more expensive hotels in the area. Very clean and newly updated rooms. Have stayed at multiple hotels in Ottawa but now find myself always going back to this one.

reviews.title: great price and location
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights and were truly impressed with the Novotel. The hotel is perfectly located (10-15 minute walk to major attractions e.g. house of parliament, market, museum of civilisation, and national gallery). The staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was very comfortable and the breakfast was far better than expected. I was somewhat sceptical about a hotel that advertised that breakfast was included in the price. My experience with hotel breakfasts in North America has been abysmal at best -- usually a stale pastry, perhaps some fruit that is well past its prime, and some liquid that has only a very faint resemblance to coffee. However, the breakfast served at the Novotel was truly impressive. If we are ever in need of a hotel room in Ottawa we will definitely stay at the Novotel.

reviews.title: Suprised
reviews.text: S.Curtis

reviews.title: Amazing hotel room
reviews.text: For some particular reason, I did not have high expectations when I made my reservation at the Novotel however, I was pleasantly suprised when I checked in. I was travelling on business and didn't get in until midnight, so I wasn't in the best mood, the agent at the front desk checked me in with exceptional service! Since they were not fully booked for the evening she upgraded me to a junior suite which lifted my spirits. Room was very simple, modern and very comfortable.

reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel
reviews.text: I enjoyed a very nice meal and class of wine in their Gallery Bar which is an asian style restaurant.

reviews.title: Great stay, pleasantly surprised
reviews.text: Location was excellent, within walking distance to the downtown core.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Novotel Ottawa in late January. We booked a Jr. Suite, which was perfect for us -- we had a living room in which to hang out, watch TV, eat the occasional pizza (I think it was from a place called Gabriel's and was closest to Chicago-style pizza), and a small bedroom in which to sleep. There were flat screen TVs in both the bedroom and living room. The bathroom was fairly large and well-appointed. The room was incredibly quiet, and use of the swimming pool was a nice plus.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, elevators, heat, and lights out one day during stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem was when we found out that the power would be out in the entire building from 9:00 am until after 5:00 pm during our stay. This led to a rush for the elevators just before 9:00. Explanations as to the reason for the outage were contradictory, and I am not sure they should have accpeted reservations for a day when no one would be able to stay in the hotel.
reviews.title: Just Fine

reviews.text: Generally, the Novotel is a simple, clean, and comfortable hotel, perfectly situated near the Rideau Centre, the Bye (sp?) Market, literally in the middle of downtown Ottawa. No cars are needed, since taxi service is plentiful.
reviews.title: Great location, solid experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for the May long weekend and was a good price considering. Staff was friendly. Room was standard and clean. The bathroom was roomy and attractive but unusually placed, being right next to the bed. There is also the bonus of being able to see the shadow of whomever was inside, because of the frosted door. Bathrooms were also not soundproofed very well. lol. Decor was fresh, with simple, modern lines. There were no in-and-out privileges for the parking lot, not that you would want to leave once you got in and actually found a spot, because it is cramped and busy, as it is not only used by Novotel patrons. Great location though, you can walk to plenty of great places if you haven't planned a detailed itinerary. I'll probably try something new next time I'm in Ottawa, but if I couldn't find a comparable rate, I would stay at the Novotel again. To resume, GOOD=location and cleanliness, BAD=parking lot. WEIRD=bathrooms.
reviews.title: A few flaws, but overall a great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part about this hotel is its excellent location right in the downtown core just steps away from the main attractions. The service is fine, the quality is solid and the price is fair. Having had a good experience at this hotel once before, I knew that a certain level of quality could be expected from the Novotel Ottawa, and I was not disappointed. Definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Great location, close to Canal

likes.disliked: — temp in room not easily controllable

description: Located in the heart of downtown Ottawa, business travelers are a short walk from the business and government districts and across the street from the Ottawa Convention Centre. With nearby attractions like the Rideau Canal, ByWard Market, Canadian War Museum, and Parliament Hill and located within walking distance of the Tulip and Winterlude annual festivals, Ottawa hotel guests enjoy comfort and relaxation in our modern design. Featuring a full buffet each morning and all day service, Novotel Trio restaurant is a great way to start or end your day.
